page.title: 19 - HOME LIFE, LIFE STYLES
page.content: Families seem equally divided as to whether they eat their main meal at midday or in the evening. As most households produce at least some of their own food, vegetables are varied and plentiful, though few people now keep chickens. Microwave ovens are gaining in popularity nationally but not in this area. As gardens are good sized, many families have at least one cat or dog. Most people tend to stay in or near their homes in the evenings, as the area is too far away from the towns and there is no public transport so television is the main pasttime. There are no hotels or restaurants in the area. The only public house is the Badger & Honeyjar, formerly the Racehorse, at Coutershaw - a one bar pub serving real ale. Outside is a good children's play area
